entities.name: uncle vernon
entities.description: Uncle Vernon is mentioned as the one who is trying to stop Harry from writing to Sirius. He has a 'would-be calm voice' and his pupils contract with fear when he thinks about it.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main character who is writing to Sirius. He is casual and tries to enjoy the effect of his words on Uncle Vernon.

entities.name: sirius
entities.description: Sirius is Harry's friend whom he writes to. If Uncle Vernon stops Harry from writing to him, Sirius will think that Harry is being mistreated.

relationships.description: Uncle Vernon tries to stop Harry from writing to Sirius. He thinks that if he does, Sirius will think that Harry is being mistreated.
Uncle Vernon is concerned about the impact of his actions on Sirius, as he thinks that if Harry doesn't write to him, Sirius will think that Harry is being mistreated.
Harry writes to his friend Sirius. He wants to keep in touch with him and make sure he knows what's going on.
